result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Robert Jones in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter has not has a pretrial.  Court recessed.  Court resumed.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentencing arguments.  Court sentenced defendant to 60 days in jail.  Submit DNA sample.  $443.00 costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  46 days jail credit.  This is a time served sentence.  11:27/12:03
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek, requesting an argued plea/sentencing hearing on 8-25-16.
